speaker: MARIA
text: Nay, I prithee, put on this gown and this beard;

speaker: MARIA
text: make him believe thou art Sir Topas the curate. Do

speaker: MARIA
text: it quickly. I’ll call Sir Toby the whilst.

speaker: FOOL
text: Well, I’ll put it on and I will dissemble myself in

speaker: FOOL
text: ’t, and I would I were the first that ever dissembled

speaker: FOOL
text:
in such a gown.
                 
                He
                 
                puts
                 
                on
                 
                gown
                 
                and
                 
                beard
                .
               I am

speaker: FOOL
text: not tall enough to become the function well, nor

speaker: FOOL
text: lean enough to be thought a good student, but to be

speaker: FOOL
text: said an honest man and a good housekeeper goes as

speaker: FOOL
text: fairly as to say a careful man and a great scholar.

speaker: FOOL
text: The competitors enter.

speaker: TOBY
text: Jove bless thee, Master Parson.

speaker: FOOL
text: Bonos dies, Sir Toby; for, as the old hermit of

speaker: FOOL
text: Prague, that never saw pen and ink, very wittily said

speaker: FOOL
text: to a niece of King Gorboduc “That that is, is,” so I,

speaker: FOOL
text: being Master Parson, am Master Parson; for what is

speaker: FOOL
text: “that” but “that” and “is” but “is”?

speaker: TOBY
text: To him, Sir Topas.

speaker: FOOL
text: What ho, I say! Peace in this

speaker: FOOL
text: prison!

speaker: TOBY
text: The knave counterfeits well. A good knave.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Who calls there?

speaker: FOOL
text: Sir Topas the curate, who comes to visit Malvolio

speaker: FOOL
text: the lunatic.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Sir Topas, Sir Topas, good Sir Topas, go to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: my lady—

speaker: FOOL
text: Out, hyperbolical fiend! How vexest thou this

speaker: FOOL
text: man! Talkest thou nothing but of ladies?

speaker: TOBY
text: Well said, Master Parson.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Sir Topas, never was man thus wronged.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Good Sir Topas, do not think I am mad. They have

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: laid me here in hideous darkness—

speaker: FOOL
text: Fie, thou dishonest Satan! I call thee by the most

speaker: FOOL
text: modest terms, for I am one of those gentle ones

speaker: FOOL
text: that will use the devil himself with courtesy. Sayst

speaker: FOOL
text: thou that house is dark?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: As hell, Sir Topas.

speaker: FOOL
text: Why, it hath bay windows transparent as barricadoes,

speaker: FOOL
text: and the clerestories toward the south-north

speaker: FOOL
text: are as lustrous as ebony; and yet complainest

speaker: FOOL
text: thou of obstruction?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: I am not mad, Sir Topas. I say to you this

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: house is dark.

speaker: FOOL
text: Madman, thou errest. I say there is no darkness

speaker: FOOL
text: but ignorance, in which thou art more puzzled than

speaker: FOOL
text: the Egyptians in their fog.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: I say this house is as dark as ignorance,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: though ignorance were as dark as hell. And I say

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: there was never man thus abused. I am no more

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: mad than you are. Make the trial of it in any

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: constant question.

speaker: FOOL
text: What is the opinion of Pythagoras concerning

speaker: FOOL
text: wildfowl?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: That the soul of our grandam might haply

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: inhabit a bird.

speaker: FOOL
text: What thinkst thou of his opinion?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: I think nobly of the soul, and no way

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: approve his opinion.

speaker: FOOL
text: Fare thee well. Remain thou still in darkness.

speaker: FOOL
text: Thou shalt hold th’ opinion of Pythagoras ere I will

speaker: FOOL
text: allow of thy wits, and fear to kill a woodcock lest

speaker: FOOL
text: thou dispossess the soul of thy grandam. Fare thee

speaker: FOOL
text: well.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Sir Topas, Sir Topas!

speaker: TOBY
text: My most exquisite Sir Topas!

speaker: FOOL
text: Nay, I am for all waters.

speaker: MARIA
text: Thou mightst have done this without thy beard

speaker: MARIA
text: and gown. He sees thee not.

speaker: TOBY
text: To him in thine own voice, and bring me word

speaker: TOBY
text: how thou find’st him. I would we were well rid

speaker: TOBY
text: of this knavery. If he may be conveniently delivered,

speaker: TOBY
text: I would he were, for I am now so far in

speaker: TOBY
text: offense with my niece that I cannot pursue with

speaker: TOBY
text: any safety this sport the upshot. Come by and by

speaker: TOBY
text: to my chamber.

speaker: FOOL
text: Hey, Robin, jolly Robin,

speaker: FOOL
text: Tell me how thy lady does.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Fool!

speaker: FOOL
text: My lady is unkind, perdy.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Fool!

speaker: FOOL
text: Alas, why is she so?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Fool, I say!

speaker: FOOL
text: She loves another—

speaker: FOOL
text: Who calls, ha?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Good fool, as ever thou wilt deserve well at

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: my hand, help me to a candle, and pen, ink, and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: paper. As I am a gentleman, I will live to be thankful

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: to thee for ’t.

speaker: FOOL
text: Master Malvolio?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Ay, good Fool.

speaker: FOOL
text: Alas, sir, how fell you besides your five wits?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Fool, there was never man so notoriously

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: abused. I am as well in my wits, Fool, as thou art.

speaker: FOOL
text: But as well? Then you are mad indeed, if you be

speaker: FOOL
text: no better in your wits than a Fool.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: They have here propertied me, keep me in

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: darkness, send ministers to me—asses!—and do

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: all they can to face me out of my wits.

speaker: FOOL
text: Advise you what you say. The minister is here.

speaker: FOOL
text:
In
                 
                the
                 
                voice
                 
                of
                 
                Sir
                 
                Topas
                .
               Malvolio, Malvolio, thy

speaker: FOOL
text: wits the heavens restore. Endeavor thyself to sleep

speaker: FOOL
text: and leave thy vain bibble-babble.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Sir Topas!

speaker: FOOL
text: Maintain no words with him, good

speaker: FOOL
text:
fellow.
                 
                As
                 
                Fool
                .
               Who, I, sir? Not I, sir! God buy

speaker: FOOL
text:
you, good Sir Topas.
                 
                As
                 
                Sir
                 
                Topas
                .
               Marry, amen.

speaker: FOOL
text:
As
                 
                Fool
                .
               I will, sir, I will.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Fool! Fool! Fool, I say!

speaker: FOOL
text: Alas, sir, be patient. What say you, sir? I am

speaker: FOOL
text: shent for speaking to you.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Good Fool, help me to some light and some

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: paper. I tell thee, I am as well in my wits as any

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: man in Illyria.

speaker: FOOL
text: Welladay that you were, sir!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: By this hand, I am. Good Fool, some ink,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: paper, and light; and convey what I will set down to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: my lady. It shall advantage thee more than ever the

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: bearing of letter did.

speaker: FOOL
text: I will help you to ’t. But tell me true, are you not

speaker: FOOL
text: mad indeed, or do you but counterfeit?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Believe me, I am not. I tell thee true.

speaker: FOOL
text: Nay, I’ll ne’er believe a madman till I see his

speaker: FOOL
text: brains. I will fetch you light and paper and ink.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Fool, I’ll requite it in the highest degree. I

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: prithee, begone.

speaker: FOOL
text:
FOOL
            
            
               
              sings
            
            
              
                I
                 
                am
                 
                gone
                ,
                 
                sir
                ,
                 
                and
                 
                anon
                ,
                 
                sir
                ,
              
              
                I’ll
                 
                be
                 
                with
                 
                you
                 
                again
                ,
              
              
                In
                 
                a
                 
                trice
                ,
                 
                like
                 
                to
                 
                the
                 
                old
                 
                Vice
                ,
              
              
                Your
                 
                need
                 
                to
                 
                sustain
                .
              
            
            
              
                Who
                 
                with
                 
                dagger
                 
                of
                 
                lath
                ,
                 
                in
                 
                his
                 
                rage
                 
                and
                 
                his
                 
                wrath
                ,
              
              
                Cries
                 
                “
                aha
                !
                ”
                 
                to
                 
                the
                 
                devil
                ;
              
              
                Like
                 
                a
                 
                mad
                 
                lad
                ,
                 
                “
                Pare
                 
                thy
                 
                nails
                ,
                 
                dad
                !
              
              
                Adieu
                ,
                 
                goodman
                 
                devil
                .
                ”
